instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?
threads.message:
hi all

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?
threads.message: Yes, even without a green light these turn on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?
threads.message:
oke, so when i put in a good battery no charger it boots into OS

when i remove battery, plug in charger it does not boot. (fan spins, green light goes orange, and i get a blinking battery symbol)

when i remove black flat io board cable and no battery it boots into OS

if i replace io board, io board cable with 100% working good on other logic board same result so io board and io board cable is not the issue.

i replaced connector on the logic board (the one for the black flat cable) no change

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?
threads.message:
no battery no io cable  (821-1722-A )
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.57V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.386

battery connected No io cable  (821-1722-A )
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.38v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.392v

battery + cable connected
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.41v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.390v

no battery but cable installed (821-1722-A )
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.59v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.392v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wil this boot  without battery?

oke SMC had corrosion on 2 pins replaced and boots perfect.
